turns.speaker: WIZARD
turns.text: Uh - now, please don't be angry with me. I'll - I'll do anything you say, only... only if you don't shout at me. It makes me nervous!

turns.speaker: SCARECROW
turns.text: It makes you nervous?

turns.speaker: WIZARD
turns.text: Yes.

turns.speaker: SCARECROW
turns.text: What about us?

turns.speaker: WIZARD
turns.text: Well, I --

turns.speaker: SCARECROW
turns.text: What about the heart that you promised Tin Man --?

turns.speaker: WIZARD
turns.text: Well, I --

turns.speaker: SCARECROW
turns.text: -- And the courage that you promised Cowardly Lion?

turns.speaker: WIZARD
turns.text: Well, I --

turns.speaker: WIZARD
turns.text: Well --

turns.speaker: SCARECROW
turns.text: You promised us real things -- a real...

turns.speaker: WIZARD
turns.text: Therefore, by virtue of the authority vested in me by the Universitatus Committeeatum e plurbis unum, I hereby confer upon you the honorary degree of Th.D.

turns.speaker: SCARECROW
turns.text: Th.D.?

turns.speaker: SCARECROW
turns.text: How can I ever thank you enough?

turns.speaker: WIZARD
turns.text: Well, you can't.  As for you, my fine friend -- you're a victim of disorganized thinking.  You are under the unfortunate delusion that simply because you run away from danger, you have no courage.  You're confusing courage with wisdom.  Back where I come from, we have men who are called heroes.  Once a year, they take their fortitude out of mothballs and parade it down the main street of the city.  And they have no more courage than you have.  But! They have one thing that you haven't got! A medal!  Therefore -- for meritorious....

turns.speaker: WIZARD
turns.text: As for you, my galvanized friend, you want a heart! You don't know how lucky you are not to have one. Hearts will never be practical until they can be made unbreakable. I could have been a world figure, a power among men, a - a successful wizard, had I not been obstructed by a heart.

turns.speaker: TIN MAN
turns.text: But I still want one.

turns.speaker: TIN MAN
turns.text: Stop that dog!

turns.speaker: WIZARD
turns.text: This is a highly irregular procedure! This is absolutely unprecedented!

turns.speaker: TIN MAN
turns.text: Oh!  Help me! The balloon's going up!

turns.speaker: WIZARD
turns.text: -- Ruined my exit!

turns.speaker: TIN MAN
turns.text: Help!

turns.speaker: CHRISTMAS
turns.text: You new?

turns.speaker: BOND
turns.text: Yes. Viktor Davidov, Miss...?

turns.speaker: CHRISTMAS
turns.text: Doctor. Jones. Christmas Jones. No jokes, Ive heard them all.

turns.speaker: BOND
turns.text: Dont know any doctor jokes.

turns.speaker: CHRISTMAS
turns.text: What happened to Len Tashka?

turns.speaker: BOND
turns.text: Couldnt make it. Splitting headache.

turns.speaker: CHRISTMAS
turns.text: The soldiers may give you a hard time. Whatever. If we werent around, theyd have their whole nuclear arsenal lying by the roadsides, rotting in the sun.

turns.speaker: CHRISTMAS
turns.text: He is an impostor.  Theres no Davidov at Miratom.

turns.speaker: BOND
turns.text: Heres your imposter. Hes paid off the men on the plane outside.  Theyre not taking the bomb to any Russian facility, theyre flying it wherever he tells them.

turns.speaker: BOND
turns.text: Shame you had to spot I wasnt the real thing.

turns.speaker: CHRISTMAS
turns.text: So who are you?

turns.speaker: BOND
turns.text: Bond --

turns.speaker: CHRISTMAS
turns.text: They wont get far. Every warhead has a locator card.  A Miratom device.  Emits a high-pitched signal on Russian emergency frequencies. We can track the bomb.

turns.speaker: BOND
turns.text: With this?

turns.speaker: BOND
turns.text: When this is over we should bury the hatchet. Celebrate. A champagne dinner?

turns.speaker: CHRISTMAS
turns.text: When this is over our bodies may be blown to smithereens.

turns.speaker: BOND
turns.text: Alright then, brunch.

turns.speaker: CHRISTMAS
turns.text: The plutonium is missing.  Theyve taken the core!

turns.speaker: BOND
turns.text: Then its no longer a bomb?

turns.speaker: CHRISTMAS
turns.text: Its a bomb alright. Were still dead if the trigger charge goes off...

turns.speaker: CHRISTMAS
turns.text: What the hell were you doing?  You nearly killed us!

turns.speaker: BOND
turns.text: I did kill us. She thinks were dead. And she thinks she got away with it.

turns.speaker: CHRISTMAS
turns.text: What the hell are you talking about?

turns.speaker: BOND
turns.text: Its part of some plan. She dresses it up like a terrorist attack.  The explosion covers up the theft of the plutonium.

turns.speaker: CHRISTMAS
turns.text: Whos she?

turns.speaker: BOND
turns.text: Elektra King.

turns.speaker: CHRISTMAS
turns.text: Elektra King?  Are you insane?  This is her pipeline.

turns.speaker: BOND
turns.text: Makes her look even more innocent.

turns.speaker: CHRISTMAS
turns.text: What would she want with weapons grade plutonium?

turns.speaker: BOND
turns.text: I was hoping you could tell me.

turns.speaker: CHRISTMAS
turns.text: What is it?

turns.speaker: BOND
turns.text: She just upped the stakes. All her chips are on the table now.  And Ms life is part of the bet.

turns.speaker: BOND
turns.text: Nuclear.

turns.speaker: CHRISTMAS
turns.text: Not just nuclear. Powered by a nuclear reactor.  Hes not loading any cargo. They want the sub. The sub itself. Put weapons grade plutonium inside the subs reactor: Instant, catastrophic meltdown.

turns.speaker: BOND
turns.text: Made to look just like an accident.

turns.speaker: CHRISTMAS
turns.text: But why? Eight million people would die, the land irradiated for a hundred years. A cloud of radiation the size of Europe...

turns.speaker: BOND
turns.text: Because an explosion like that would kill all the other pipelines. There would be only one way to get the oil out of the Caspian and pump it to the world...

turns.speaker: CHRISTMAS
turns.text: The King pipeline.

turns.speaker: BOND
turns.text: Elektra would control it all.

turns.speaker: CHRISTMAS
turns.text: Zukovsky...

turns.speaker: BOND
turns.text: If I dont get to the Boa before he gets to Maidens Tower, M is dead.

turns.speaker: CHRISTMAS
turns.text: Is there another way?

turns.speaker: BOND
turns.text: We go down to the torpedo bay.

turns.speaker: BOND
turns.text: Hes sealed himself in.

turns.speaker: CHRISTMAS
turns.text: Hes going to insert the plutonium.

turns.speaker: CHRISTMAS
turns.text: Do you know what youre doing?

turns.speaker: BOND
turns.text: Like riding a bike.

turns.speaker: CHRISTMAS
turns.text: What kind of bikes did you ride?

turns.speaker: BOND
turns.text: Just wanted to put him on edge...

turns.speaker: BOND
turns.text: Count to twenty.  When you get to twenty open the hatch.  It can only be opened for a few seconds or well sink.

turns.speaker: CHRISTMAS
turns.text: But what if...

turns.speaker: BOND
turns.text: Count to twenty.  Ill be there.

turns.speaker: BOND
turns.text: Weve got to get out.

turns.speaker: CHRISTMAS
turns.text: We cant.

turns.speaker: BOND
turns.text: I love Christmas in Turkey.

turns.speaker: CHRISTMAS
turns.text: So isnt it time you unwrapped your present?

turns.speaker: DOCTOR GREATREX
turns.text: Dislocated collar bone.  If any more tendons snap...  It wont just be two weeks out of action.

turns.speaker: BOND
turns.text: I need you to pass me fit now, Molly.

turns.speaker: BOND
turns.text: Its just a scratch.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR GREATREX
turns.text: James.  It wouldnt really be...

turns.speaker: DOCTOR GREATREX
turns.text: Then maybe Id be... open to that.

turns.speaker: BOND
turns.text: Perhaps after this ... test?

turns.speaker: BOND
turns.text: I could come for a second opinion?

turns.speaker: BOND
turns.text: Constructions not exactly my line.

turns.speaker: M
turns.text: Quite the opposite, in fact.

turns.speaker: BOND
turns.text: Old friend?

turns.speaker: M
turns.text: Since Oxford. I knew him when he had nothing but a brilliant mind and enough guts to conquer the world. Hes a man of great integrity.

turns.speaker: BOND
turns.text: Who buys classified reports for three million pounds.

turns.speaker: M
turns.text: Elektra?  Running King Industries?  Ive known that girl all her life. Im not sure she knows what shes walking into.

turns.speaker: BOND
turns.text: Shes not a girl anymore.

turns.speaker: M
turns.text: Ive scheduled a medical for you.

turns.speaker: BOND
turns.text: Its barely a scratch. The Dome broke my fall.

turns.speaker: M
turns.text: Well, at least it turned out to have some purpose.

turns.speaker: M
turns.text: 007. What do you know of the Caspian Sea?

turns.speaker: BOND
turns.text: Caviar capital of the world. Matchless beluga. Firm, yet subtle.  Largest landlocked body of water on Earth.  Oil-rich.  Hitler wanted it. Stalin beat him to it.

turns.speaker: M
turns.text: And now its up for grabs, a goldrush. Far more oil than anyone thought.

turns.speaker: M
turns.text: Who told you to look at Elektras files?

turns.speaker: BOND
turns.text: I took the initiative.

turns.speaker: M
turns.text: You havent been given an assignment in this case.

turns.speaker: BOND
turns.text: I was the one who brought that money in...

turns.speaker: M
turns.text: Im well aware of your stake in this, 007. If you have a point, get to it.

turns.speaker: BOND
turns.text: The amount of money that killed Robert King is the same amount as the ransom demand for Elektra.

turns.speaker: M
turns.text: Its a message.  He wants us to know hes back.

turns.speaker: BOND
turns.text: Who?

turns.speaker: M
turns.text: Claude Serrault.  A.K.A...

turns.speaker: BOND
turns.text: Renard.

turns.speaker: M
turns.text: Sir Robert tried to deal with the kidnapping with his own...resources, at first. When Elektras ear was delivered to him in the post, he came to me.  I advised against paying the ransom. I knew it was Renard. I played it out as long as possible to get a fix on him.

turns.speaker: BOND
turns.text: Sacrifice the girl to take out the terrorist?

turns.speaker: M
turns.text: How many deaths is he responsible for? How many innocent people? You may only get one shot at a man like Renard. Same circumstances, Id do the same again.

turns.speaker: BOND
turns.text: He survived?

turns.speaker: M
turns.text: The doctor who saved him couldnt get it out, so Renard killed him. When Interpol found the x-rays, there was mild jubilation. Effectively, hes a dead man.

turns.speaker: M
turns.text: The bullet is moving through the medulla oblongata, killing off his sense of touch. He feels no pain. He can push himself harder, longer than any normal man.

turns.speaker: BOND
turns.text: That which does not kill me makes me stronger.

turns.speaker: M
turns.text: Now Robert is dead. He got his revenge.

turns.speaker: BOND
turns.text: Hes not through yet. Renard doesnt blow up five million dollars unless he knows theres more coming in. Hes working for someone. Someone who wants to stop the pipeline.  And they hired the perfect killer. One with a vendetta against King...and you.

turns.speaker: M
turns.text: Get out to the pipeline. Find the insider who switched the pin. If your instincts are right, Renard will be back. He hasnt completed the job. The pipeline is still going forward, and we have Elektra to thank for that.

turns.speaker: BOND
turns.text: The worm on the hook again.

turns.speaker: BOND
turns.text: The report King bought. Its a manual. Renards men used it to remove this radio tracking device from the warhead.

turns.speaker: M
turns.text: Then Robert was right about a Russian connection.

turns.speaker: BOND
turns.text: Theyre getting their weapons from the Russians, but where are they getting the money to buy the weapons?  I cant help thinking...the person close to King, the one who switched that pin...

turns.speaker: M
turns.text: The inside man?

turns.speaker: BOND
turns.text: Is maybe...the inside woman.

turns.speaker: LACHAISE
turns.text: Not the usual Swiss procedure, Mr. Bond, but you understand, a man in my position..

turns.speaker: BOND
turns.text: Which is neutral, no doubt.

turns.speaker: LACHAISE
turns.text: I did not get the report from an MI-6 agent.

turns.speaker: BOND
turns.text: Who did you get it from?

turns.speaker: LACHAISE
turns.text: I am just a middle man. I am doing the honourable thing and returning the money to its rightful owner...

turns.speaker: BOND
turns.text: And we know how difficult that can be for the Swiss.

turns.speaker: LACHAISE
turns.text: Your last chance. Take the money.

turns.speaker: BOND
turns.text: Your last chance. Give me the name.

turns.speaker: LACHAISE
turns.text: Stripped of all your weaponry, you still threaten me?

turns.speaker: BOND
turns.text: The name?

turns.speaker: LACHAISE
turns.text: I cant tell you...  Alright, alright! But you must protect me!

turns.speaker: RENARD
turns.text: I see my friend Davidov ran into some difficulty.

turns.speaker: BOND
turns.text: Indeed.

turns.speaker: BOND
turns.text: Revenge isnt so hard to fathom. Whats clever is getting someone else to pay for it.

turns.speaker: RENARD
turns.text: Not many people in this world have that kind of fortune.

turns.speaker: BOND
turns.text: Who is it?

turns.speaker: RENARD
turns.text: You think I fear death? I welcome it. I get on my knees and pray for it. You, on the other hand, you have something to live for, no?  Shes beautiful isnt she? You should have seen her before. Flawless, and still so innocent, not such a whore in bed...

turns.speaker: BOND
turns.text: You will never touch her. You will never get near her.

turns.speaker: RENARD
turns.text: Have you forgotten who saved your life in Geneva?

turns.speaker: BOND
turns.text: Consider me ungrateful.

turns.speaker: RENARD
turns.text: Its I who should thank you -- for taking that money back to MI-6.  So distressing for M.  An explosion inside her lair.

turns.speaker: BOND
turns.text: Shell get over it.

turns.speaker: RENARD
turns.text: You even brought the plane for us.  We really couldnt have done it without you.

turns.speaker: RENARD
turns.text: In case youve forgotten.  Im dead already.

turns.speaker: BOND
turns.text: Havent you heard the news?  So is she.

turns.speaker: WOMAN
turns.text: Beautiful, isnt it?

turns.speaker: BOND
turns.text: Yes.

turns.speaker: WOMAN
turns.text: Today, of all days, the sun decides to shine.

turns.speaker: BOND
turns.text: Perhaps Sir Robert had a word with the Man Upstairs.

turns.speaker: WOMAN
turns.text: A word? Im sure by now hes engineered a hostile takeover.

turns.speaker: BOND
turns.text: You knew him well?

turns.speaker: WOMAN
turns.text: He was my father.

turns.speaker: BOND
turns.text: Im sorry.

turns.speaker: WOMAN
turns.text: He died before he could complete his lifelong dream.  I intend to finish it for him.

turns.speaker: ELEKTRA
turns.text: I met you at my fathers funeral.

turns.speaker: BOND
turns.text: Yes.

turns.speaker: ELEKTRA
turns.text: I havent been able to recall a single moment of that day...until now.

turns.speaker: BOND
turns.text: Funerals arent exactly memorable.

turns.speaker: ELEKTRA
turns.text: God no. All those horrible loved ones and relatives. I dont want to talk to those people. I just want to...talk to my father.  I loved him.  Im not sure he knew that.

turns.speaker: BOND
turns.text: Is that why you want to finish the pipeline?

turns.speaker: ELEKTRA
turns.text: Partially, yes.

turns.speaker: BOND
turns.text: Who is he?

turns.speaker: ELEKTRA
turns.text: My bodyguard. He follows me everywhere. Hes decisive, vigilant.  And he makes an excellent omelette.

turns.speaker: BOND
turns.text: How long has he been with you?

turns.speaker: ELEKTRA
turns.text: Since the kidnapping. Why do you ask?

turns.speaker: BOND
turns.text: Does this look familiar to you?

turns.speaker: ELEKTRA
turns.text: Its my fathers pin. He wore it everyday of his life.

turns.speaker: ELEKTRA
turns.text: Are you trying to break my heart? Or is it just your way with women?

turns.speaker: BOND
turns.text: Its not the pin your father wore. Its an exact duplicate. Inside is a tiny electrical detonator. We have reason to believe the assassin had an inside accomplice, someone who worked at this company.

turns.speaker: ELEKTRA
turns.text: If youve come here to look after me, Mr. Bond, thank you, but no thank you.  I have two bodyguards, I dont need a third...

turns.speaker: BOND
turns.text: The killer doesnt want to see this pipeline continue, doesnt want to see you take over...

turns.speaker: ELEKTRA
turns.text: Thats every man within a five mile radius.  Including you.  Thats why youre here, isnt it? You think I cant do it. You think Im going to screw up. Or get myself killed.

turns.speaker: BOND
turns.text: I think running this pipeline would be a difficult job for anyone. Especially Kings daughter.

turns.speaker: ELEKTRA
turns.text: You are wrong, Mr. Bond. In fact, I am the only person who can do it.

turns.speaker: ELEKTRA
turns.text: I have to check the upper lines.  Gabor will drive you back.

turns.speaker: BOND
turns.text: Always wanted to see the upper lines.

turns.speaker: ELEKTRA
turns.text: You dont take no for an answer, do you?

turns.speaker: BOND
turns.text: No.

turns.speaker: ELEKTRA
turns.text: Oh my God...were buried alive...

turns.speaker: BOND
turns.text: Were alright.

turns.speaker: ELEKTRA
turns.text: I cant stay here.

turns.speaker: BOND
turns.text: Youre not going to.

turns.speaker: ELEKTRA
turns.text: No!  It will cave in!

turns.speaker: BOND
turns.text: Its the only way out...

turns.speaker: BOND
turns.text: I cant stay.

turns.speaker: ELEKTRA
turns.text: I know.

turns.speaker: ELEKTRA
turns.text: The way I acted, in the snow...you must think Im a coward.

turns.speaker: BOND
turns.text: I think youre one of the bravest people Ive ever met.

turns.speaker: ELEKTRA
turns.text: What is it?

turns.speaker: BOND
turns.text: ...you should rest.

turns.speaker: ELEKTRA
turns.text: James...

turns.speaker: BOND
turns.text: I have to go.

turns.speaker: ELEKTRA
turns.text: Then take me with you.

turns.speaker: BOND
turns.text: No. Youll be safe here.

turns.speaker: ELEKTRA
turns.text: I dont want to be safe!

turns.speaker: BOND
turns.text: I have to go to work.

turns.speaker: ELEKTRA
turns.text: Vodka martini.

turns.speaker: BOND
turns.text: Two. Shaken not stirred.

turns.speaker: BOND
turns.text: What the hell are you doing here?

turns.speaker: ELEKTRA
turns.text: Someone wants to kill me, Id rather die looking him straight in the eye.  What are you doing here?  Looking for a woman a little more your type? How about that one?

turns.speaker: BOND
turns.text: If this little show is for my benefit, Ill take you home right now.

turns.speaker: ELEKTRA
turns.text: You had your chance, James. Now Im looking for a bigger thrill.

turns.speaker: BOND
turns.text: I understand its normally good practice to get the feel of the cards before going off the deep end.

turns.speaker: ELEKTRA
turns.text: Really?

turns.speaker: ELEKTRA
turns.text: Surely you believe in living dangerously.

turns.speaker: BOND
turns.text: Not at that price. Time to surrender.

turns.speaker: ELEKTRA
turns.text: You knew when you first saw me.  You knew it would be like this.

turns.speaker: BOND
turns.text: Shush.

turns.speaker: BOND
turns.text: How did you survive?

turns.speaker: ELEKTRA
turns.text: I used my body on the guards.  It gave me control. I got to a gun and I took my chance.  Ive never told anyone that.

turns.speaker: ELEKTRA
turns.text: Whats wrong with you?  Are you crazy?

turns.speaker: BOND
turns.text: A little. Does it matter? After all, whats the point of living if you cant feel alive?  Isnt that right, Elektra? Isnt that your motto?

turns.speaker: ELEKTRA
turns.text: What are you talking about?

turns.speaker: BOND
turns.text: Or did you steal it from your old friend Renard?

turns.speaker: ELEKTRA
turns.text: ...what?

turns.speaker: BOND
turns.text: We had a run-in, he and I. He knew about us, he knew about my shoulder, he knew exactly where to hurt me...

turns.speaker: ELEKTRA
turns.text: Are you saying...Renard is the man whos trying to kill me?

turns.speaker: BOND
turns.text: You can drop the act, its over.

turns.speaker: ELEKTRA
turns.text: I dont know what youre talking about!

turns.speaker: BOND
turns.text: I think you do.

turns.speaker: ELEKTRA
turns.text: How dare you!  How dare you! That animal!?  That monster!? He disgusts me! You disgust me!  So he knew where to hurt you, is that it? You had a sling on your arm at the funeral! I didnt have to sleep with you to find that out.

turns.speaker: BOND
turns.text: He used your exact words.

turns.speaker: ELEKTRA
turns.text: You knew.  You knew all the time, that he was out there, that he was coming for me, and you lied. You used me, you used me as bait. You made love to me -- what, to pass the time as you waited for him to strike?

turns.speaker: BOND
turns.text: Im coming with you.

turns.speaker: ELEKTRA
turns.text: You do what you have to do, but Ive called in M.  Shes en route from London even now.

turns.speaker: ELEKTRA
turns.text: I could have given you the world.

turns.speaker: BOND
turns.text: Not interested.

turns.speaker: BOND
turns.text: Wheres M?

turns.speaker: ELEKTRA
turns.text: Soon shell be everywhere.

turns.speaker: BOND
turns.text: All this, because you fell for Renard?

turns.speaker: ELEKTRA
turns.text: Five more turns and your neck will break.

turns.speaker: ELEKTRA
turns.text: Since I was a child, Ive always had a power over men. When I realized my father wouldnt rescue me from the kidnappers, I knew I had to form a new alliance.

turns.speaker: BOND
turns.text: You turned Renard.

turns.speaker: ELEKTRA
turns.text: Just like you...only you were even easier.

turns.speaker: BOND
turns.text: So you killed your father.

turns.speaker: ELEKTRA
turns.text: He killed me! He killed me the day he refused to pay my ransom.

turns.speaker: BOND
turns.text: Was this all about the oil?

turns.speaker: ELEKTRA
turns.text: It is my oil!  Mine and my familys!

turns.speaker: ELEKTRA
turns.text: It runs in my veins, thicker than blood. Im going to redraw the map. And when I am through the whole world will know my name, my grandfathers name, the glory of my people.

turns.speaker: BOND
turns.text: No-one will believe this melt-down was an accident.

turns.speaker: ELEKTRA
turns.text: Know what happens when a man is strangled?

turns.speaker: BOND
turns.text: Elektra, its not too late.  Eight million people neednt die.

turns.speaker: BOND
turns.text: One... last... screw?

turns.speaker: ELEKTRA
turns.text: Oh James.

turns.speaker: BOND
turns.text: Valentin Zukovsky.

turns.speaker: ZUKOVSKY
turns.text: BondJamesBond. What brings you here?

turns.speaker: BOND
turns.text: You, of course. I need some information.

turns.speaker: ZUKOVSKY
turns.text: Bond, Im a civilian. This is my place. Used to be the royal familys, now its mine. I run my little business, I stay out of trouble...

turns.speaker: BOND
turns.text: Mafia warlords, Diplomats and spies, consortiums from every country in the world.  A nice little rats nest.

turns.speaker: ZUKOVSKY
turns.text: Have some of the rats nest caviar.  From my own fishery.  They buy my caviar, drink my champagne, lose to my House.

turns.speaker: ZUKOVSKY
turns.text: See?  Youre upsetting my customers. What do you want?

turns.speaker: BOND
turns.text: How does a terrorist like Renard supply his men with state-of-the-art Russian Army weapons?

turns.speaker: ZUKOVSKY
turns.text: What?  This is not possible.

turns.speaker: BOND
turns.text: If I remember my Cyrillic that says 101st airborne division.

turns.speaker: ZUKOVSKY
turns.text: Where did you get this?

turns.speaker: BOND
turns.text: Off a high-powered Paraski that was trying to kill me.

turns.speaker: ZUKOVSKY
turns.text: That too. Everyone does what they can to survive.

turns.speaker: BOND
turns.text: How high up does this...arms dealing go?

turns.speaker: ZUKOVSKY
turns.text: Bond. If someone wants you dead, it is Renard. Our government has nothing to gain by killing you.

turns.speaker: BOND
turns.text: But you would have something to gain by killing Robert King. And stopping his pipeline.

turns.speaker: ZUKOVSKY
turns.text: What are doing, Bond?  Trying to impress this innocent thing?

turns.speaker: BOND
turns.text: Shes no innocent.  This is my nuclear consultant.

turns.speaker: ZUKOVSKY
turns.text: Ah, I see.  A purely...plutonic relationship.

turns.speaker: ZUKOVSKY
turns.text: Really Bond, couldnt you find a nice Russian scientist with hair growing out of his ears?

turns.speaker: BOND
turns.text: Whats your business with Elektra King?

turns.speaker: ZUKOVSKY
turns.text: I thought you were the one in her business.

turns.speaker: BOND
turns.text: She dropped a million and half dollars to the House -- your House. And you didnt even bat an eyelid.  She was paying you off.  What for?

turns.speaker: ZUKOVSKY
turns.text: As ever you are the spy who has to see a plot wherever he looks.

turns.speaker: ZUKOVSKY
turns.text: That is 5,000 dollars of Beluga ruined!

turns.speaker: BOND
turns.text: You are out of your league.  Shes working with Renard.

turns.speaker: BOND
turns.text: Now...where were we?

turns.speaker: ZUKOVSKY
turns.text: A rope!

turns.speaker: BOND
turns.text: No.  The truth!  She thought I was dead -- those blades were meant for you.  What do you know that she would kill you for?

turns.speaker: ZUKOVSKY
turns.text: Alright, alright!  Sometimes I smuggle machinery for her.  Russian stuff.

turns.speaker: BOND
turns.text: And the payoff on the tables?

turns.speaker: ZUKOVSKY
turns.text: A special job.  A...a...a submarine.

turns.speaker: BOND
turns.text: Wheres the sub going?!

turns.speaker: ZUKOVSKY
turns.text: No!  Get me out!

turns.speaker: BOND
turns.text: This is too big for even you.  Where is it?

turns.speaker: ZUKOVSKY
turns.text: This is a family matter! If my nephew is in danger, we do it my way, or nothing! Now get me out!

turns.speaker: ZUKOVSKY
turns.text: So.  My way.  No MI-6, no Interpol.  Just you, me and my people.

turns.speaker: BOND
turns.text: Where?

turns.speaker: ZUKOVSKY
turns.text: Istanbul.

turns.speaker: ZUKOVSKY
turns.text: Mother of God.

turns.speaker: BOND
turns.text: The right kind of explosion in the right spot -- it would block the Bosphorus, cut off the Black Sea.

turns.speaker: ZUKOVSKY
turns.text: The Maidens Tower.

turns.speaker: BOND
turns.text: How appropriate.

turns.speaker: ZUKOVSKY
turns.text: Id heard there were some renovations there...no one would look for a sub in that place in a million years.

turns.speaker: CHRISTMAS
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: ZUKOVSKY
turns.text: To haul some cargo. My nephew, he is Captain of a sub in the Black Sea Fleet.
